column1: Adenoid removal is surgery to take out the adenoid glands.
Adenoid removal is also called adenoidectomy.
The procedure is most often done in children.
Your child will be given general anesthesia before surgery.
- Absorbent material called packing material may also be used to control bleeding.
Symptoms in your child can include heavy snoring, problems breathing through the nose, and episodes of not breathing during sleep.
- Your child has chronic ear infections that occur often, continue despite use of antibiotics, cause hearing loss, or cause the child to miss a lot of school days.
Adenoidectomy may also be recommended if your child has tonsillitis that keeps coming back.
